intro: Vinticena welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitschia tree, is a unique plant native to the Namib Desert in Namibia. It is characterized by its thick, woody trunk and large, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in arid conditions. The plant has two main types of leaves: adult, broad, and juvenile, narrow leaves, which are a distinguishing feature. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers and is adapted to survive in extreme environmental conditions. Vinticena welwitschii is considered a living fossil, with a lineage dating back millions of years.
